contentrichtext.text: '''Donald Lee Gambril''' (born January 2, 1934) is an American former [[swimming (sport)|swimming]] [[coach (sport)|coach]]. [Rosemead Swimming Club 1958 - 1959] [Rosemead High School Swimming Coach 1960,1961,1962,1963] He was the [[1984 Summer Olympics|1984]] U.S. Olympic Coach and Assistant U.S. Olympic Coach in [[1968 Summer Olympics|1968]], [[1972 Summer Olympics|1972]], [[1976 Summer Olympics|1976]], and [[1980 Summer Olympics|1980]]. Gambril coached many well-known Olympic swimmers, such as [[Mark Spitz]], [[Sharon Stouder]], and [[Gunnar Larsson (swimmer)|Gunnar Larsson]] (Sweden), [[Matt Biondi]], [[Nancy Hogshead]], [[Jonty Skinner]] (South Africa), [[Hans-Joachim Fassnacht|Hans Fassnacht]] (Germany)<ref>[http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-41651441.html ''Der Spiegel'' August 26, 1974]</ref> and [[Mary T. Meagher]]. He was [[head coach]] at the [[University of Alabama]] for 17 years. Gambril was head coach at Long Beach State before a two-year stint from 1971 to 1973 as head coach at [[Harvard University]]. In 1973, Gambril became head coach at the University of Alabama, where he coached the men's team for 17 years and the women's team for 11 years, retiring from coaching in 1990. He has been inducted into the [[International Swimming Hall of Fame]]<ref>[http://www.ishof.org/honorees/83/83dgambril.html Gambril's bio]</ref> and received the [[USA Swimming Award]] in 1983. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Footer USA Swimming 1968 Summer Olympics}} {{Footer USA Swimming 1972 Summer Olympics}} {{Footer USA Swimming 1976 Summer Olympics}} {{Footer USA Swimming 1980 Summer Olympics}} {{Footer USA Swimming 1984 Summer Olympics}} {{Authority control|VIAF=116537234}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Gambril, Don | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Gambril, Donald Lee; Gambril, Donald L. | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American college swimming coach, Olympic swimming coach | DATE OF BIRTH = January 2, 1934 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Altamont, Kansas, United States | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gambril, Don}} [[Category:1934 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alabama Crimson Tide coaches]] [[Category:American Olympic coaches]] [[Category:American swimming coaches]] [[Category:California State University, Long Beach people]] [[Category:College swimming coaches in the United States]] [[Category:Harvard Crimson coaches]] [[Category:People from Labette County, Kansas]] {{US-swimming-bio-stub}}
